SAYS: I only really care about like when I go to the site, I want to... see, you know, what the goal of the organization is.
I go to the events thing and really the events tab is all that I use.
I typically use the events calendar view, just because it has it laid out in a way where I can see it the month at a glance.
It would be helpful to know which events still have openings or have it blocked out.
For the most part, if I see wait list for every single thing I'm interested in, then I kind of stop looking at the website too.
It sucks up more time for it causes more work for everybody.
I think it creates extra work for the organizers as well if they could just easily have a cancellation button.
The top I just don't go to the page. It just doesn't really serve much purpose for me.
I guess, I think it's best if like... why join? I'm not sure we really need to like sell people on this proposition.
THINKS: The website should prioritize ease of use for current members.
There’s a disconnect between what potential members need and what current members find useful.
If I consistently encounter waitlists, I may lose interest in the events altogether.
I believe there should be clearer indicators for event availability to minimize frustration.
The organization might benefit from a more streamlined website experience.
Some tabs seem redundant and could be merged or eliminated for better navigation.
DOES: Elaine navigates directly to the events tab without exploring other sections.
She uses the calendar view to quickly assess available events.
Elaine actively seeks out information about events but gives up if she finds too many waitlists.
She reached out to the event organizer via email to cancel an event.
Elaine has engaged with the site’s committee tab only when necessary (for specific events).
FEELS: A sense of clarity and ease when using the events calendar.
Annoyance at having to navigate a cluttered website.
Appreciation for the organization’s goal of community building.
Anxiety about overcomplicating the user experience for herself and others.
She feels that the current organization of the website does not align with her needs as a member.
